description.narrative: Strongly increased in health areas using CORDAID's CODESA approach compared to Control Health Zones. This is justified by the strong interaction between the community and the Health Unit following the involvement of CODESA members in all health activities in the health area.

The objective of this project is to foster the effective involvement of all stakeholders including the community, health service providers, leaders (community, customary and religious) and health sector stakeholders in order to improve quality of health services provided to the population by health centres. CODESA training improves community accountability for health care and ultimately helps health facilities provide better services - tailored to the needs of the population and accessible to all. CODESA use the Community Score Cards to inventory needs.
